title: Functional effects models: Accounting for preference heterogeneity in panel data with machine learning
summary: This paper introduces Functional Effects Models, which use Machine Learning to learn individual-specific preference parameters from socio-demographic characteristics, addressing inter-individual heterogeneity in panel choice data. The model offers advantages over traditional fixed and random/mixed effects models by mapping individual-specific effects as a function of socio-demographic factors.

The focus on individual-specific preference parameters and heterogeneity also aligns with analyzing contextual information in data.
